content.body: Domenic: maybe an initial goal should be to just get a decent overview of document state APIs may depend on: bfcache/fully active/prerender/focused/visible?
content.formatted_body: Domenic: maybe an initial goal should be to just get a decent overview of document state APIs may depend on: bfcache/fully active/prerender/focused/visible?

content.body: And yeah, delay makes sense to me given that the event loop runs.
annevk: yeah I like that goal. Especially now that we have things like system focus more well-defined.
content.formatted_body: annevk: yeah I like that goal. Especially now that we have things like system focus more well-defined.

content.body: User activation is another one we found, e.g. a lot of APIs needed no changes for prerendering since they were dependent on user activation which can never happen while prerendered.
Domenic: hmm, I guess that depends on how user activation delegation works, does that do some kind of same TLBC check?
content.formatted_body: Domenic: hmm, I guess that depends on how user activation delegation works, does that do some kind of same TLBC check?

content.body: Well we made prerendering BCs top-level BCs so I think it wouldn't impact it?
Oh, and even with that it might go wrong? If the same TLBC is used for the prerendered doc? Or maybe that doesn't work. How does that work? ðŸ™‚
